settings.Name: The Nile
settings.Description:
A calm wide river divides the map into western and eastern parts.

The Nile is a major north-flowing river in northeastern Africa, generally regarded as the longest river in the world. The Nile has been the lifeline of civilization in Egypt since the Stone Age, with most of the population and all of the cities of Egypt resting along those parts of the Nile valley lying north of Aswan. Climate change at the end of the most recent ice age led to the formation of the Sahara desert, possibly as long ago as 3400 BC. It was so important to the life of Egypt that the Greek historian Herodotus wrote that Egypt was the gift of the Nile.
